thread.title: Putin wins Russia's presidential election: exit poll

title: Putin wins Russia's presidential election: exit poll
text: March 18, 2018 / 6:07 PM / Updated 34 minutes ago Putin wins Russia's presidential election: exit poll Reuters Staff 1 Min Read MOSCOW (Reuters) - An exit poll showed Vladimir Putin won Russiaâ€™s presidential election held on Sunday with 73.9 percent of the vote. Russian President and Presidential candidate Vladimir Putin at a polling station during the presidential election in Moscow, Russia March 18, 2018. Yuri Kadobnov/POOL via Reuters The voting projection, by pollster VTsIOM, put Communist party challenger Pavel Grudinin in second place with 11.2 percent. Vladimir Zhirinovsky, head of the nationalist Liberal Democratic Party, was on 6.7 pct, and TV personality Ksenia Sobchak had 2.5 percent, the exit poll showed. Reporting by Denis Pinchuk, Andrew Osborn and Katya Golubkova, Writing by Maria Kiselyova, editing by Christian Lowe
